title.narrative: IR 1.7 WASH IN COMMUNITY & HEALTH CENTER

description.narrative: IR 1.7 WASH in Community & Health Center In target districts, i) all health centres have access to water and sanitation facilities, ii) the percentage of population with access to safe, sustained water and sanitation facilities has increased from 54% to 77% and from 34% to 77%, respectively, iii) the percentage of households with access to (and using) handwashing facilities has increased from 22% to 50% by 2014, and iv) open defecation has been eliminated in at least 200 villages.

mailing-address.narrative: Plot 9 George Street PO Box 7047 Kampala

sector.narrative: Hygiene - handwashing with soap in communities
Public health emergencies, including disease outbreaks
Sanitation - eliminating open defecation in peri-urban and urban communities
Sanitation - improving services in rural communities (except household water treatment and storage, moving up the ladder and strengthening sustainability)
Sanitation and hygiene - eliminating open defecation in rural communities
Sanitation and hygiene - improving services in emergency communities
Sanitation and hygiene - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) including menstrual hygiene management
WASH - Enabling environment (policies/strategies, coordination, regulation, financing, planning-monitoring-review, sector capacity development and professionalization)
Water - climate resilience and environmental sustainability
Water supply - peri-urban and urban communities service delivery
Water supply - rural communities service delivery
Water supply - safety/quality/treatment (including household treatment and safe storage)

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities emergency relief
Water supply and Sanitation policy, planning and administration
Water supply and Sanitation rural sanitation

title.narrative: Uganda United Nations Development Assistance Framework
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Uganda 2019 Annual Report on Results for Children
Uganda Country Office 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

related-activity.ref: 4380/A0/04/105 YI105 - PCR 1 KEEP CHILDREN AND MOTHERS

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: IR 1.7 WASH in Community & Health Center In target districts, i) all health centres have access to water and sanitation facilities, ii) the percentage of population with access to safe, sustained water and sanitation facilities has increased from 54% to 77% and from 34% to 77%, respectively, iii) the percentage of households with access to (and using) handwashing facilities has increased from 22% to 50% by 2014, and iv) open defecation has been eliminated in at least 200 villages.
